MajorClaims.MC1: reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies

Claims.C1: these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners
Claims.C2: fiction books pay more attention to details
Claims.C3: reading a novel is more convenient

Premises.P1: we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it
Premises.P2: Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening
Premises.P3: after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people
Premises.P4: a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters
Premises.P5: Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour
Premises.P6: Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains
Premises.P7: I have started to read a novel since last week
Premises.P8: I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class
Premises.P9: I cannot watch a complete movie
Premises.P10: I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study
Premises.P11: they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies
Premises.P12: movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners
Premises.P13: characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners
Premises.P14: For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable
